column4: my resolution is set to 1024x768, when it's supposed to be set to 1368x768. what do I do?
go to the monitor preferences and change it
it's not there, that's the problem
Ubuntu isn't detecting the proper resolution
on the old times you could edit xorg.conf. But I think ubuntu doesn't use X anymore so I don't know how to fix it
that's on 11.10, afaik
rgr, oh! I thought they were going to change now on 11.04. Can you say I haven't upgraded yet? :p
can you look into /etc/X11/xorg.conf then?
as ohsix said, it isn't there
then run sudo Xorg --configure
already tried that, it fails with the error "Number of created screens does not match number of detected devices"
are you using only 1 monitor?
yes
I googled a bit and some people say you need to stop X before running that. That means you'd have to go to a tty, and stop the GUI for some time
I did do that; alt-ctrl-F2, sudo stop service gdm
ok. Could you pastebin the X log then?
pastebin the contents of /var/log/Xorg.0.log
http://pastebin.com/YbK35Uy1
well, I can't find any error there
what resolution should it be?
1368x768, a 16:9 resolution
I have to go now. But take a look at this, it might be of help https://wiki.ubuntu.com/X/Config/Resolution#Adding%20undetected%20resolutions
and good luck fixing it
